intro: Didactyle antennifera, commonly known as the false buttonweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has finely divided leaves and produces small, inconspicuous fruits called cypselae. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in moist, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various environmental conditions.
